text: How can I do 3D matrix multiplication?  How about 4D?  It doesn’t look like there is anything in Base or any of the standard libraries.  I found this online: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32685517/> but that seems really slow, as it relies on reshaping…  I might just have to define it myself, or does anyone know if there exists a package that provides this functionality?

attachments.title: How to multiply multi-dimensional arrays/matrices in Julia
attachments.text: Multiplying two multi-dimensional arrays, say, a 1-dimensional with a 3-dimensional array: [1 2] * reshape(1:8,2,2,2) gives me the error message: LoadError: MethodError: `*` has no method matchi...
attachments.fallback: Stack Overflow: How to multiply multi-dimensional arrays/matrices in Julia

elements.text: How can I do 3D matrix multiplication?  How about 4D?  It doesn’t look like there is anything in Base or any of the standard libraries.  I found this online:
but that seems really slow, as it relies on reshaping…  I might just have to define it myself, or does anyone know if there exists a package that provides this functionality?

text: reshaping is `O(1)` it doesn't make a copy
that said `@tullio` may also be a good sollution here

elements.text: may also be a good sollution here

text: I can’t find that in Base.  Is that this one?  <https://github.com/mcabbott/Tullio.jl>

elements.text: I can’t find that in Base.  Is that this one?

text: yeah. It's built on `LoopVectorization` but adds even more smarts
I’ll have a play around with that, thanks!  Michael Abbott seems to be a genius when it comes to this kind of work, makes sense he authored this :smile:

elements.text: I’ll have a play around with that, thanks!  Michael Abbott seems to be a genius when it comes to this kind of work, makes sense he authored this

text:
> reshaping is `O(1)` it doesn’t make a copy
<@U0179G7FG4F> It seems like it would be difficult to generalise the reshaping for higher dimensions, is all…

elements.text: It seems like it would be difficult to generalise the reshaping for higher dimensions, is all…

text: yeah. `reshape` is only a good solution if you are already  in proper memory order to turn it into a matmul
